title: The Silent Coup
outcome: A Directorate-led coup disables the Council, imposing martial order while neighborhoods rebel by refusing to generate BCI data. Citizens sabotage surveillance and revert to analog communication, undermining control. The city teeters between imposed stability and a grassroots movement for freedom, forcing a choice between renewed authoritarianism or dismantling the BCI system.

events.description: The Directorate occupies Council offices and suspends all sessions. Martial protocols are announced and curfews imposed, under threat of severe BCI penalties.
Neighborhoods respond by rejecting all digital services. Citizens sabotage BCI sensors, block biometric scans, and organize analog communication networks in defiance.
Service delays and BCI errors multiply. Essential city functions break down, forcing local groups to self-organize food, transport, and aid. The Directorate cannot restore order without cooperation.
Meanwhile, activists push for full abolition of the BCI; public support for the mutiny grows as life without scoring sees a resurgence of trust and mutual aid.
A final stand-off unfolds: The Directorate demands renewed digital obedience, but the majority refuse, sparking mass noncompliance and tipping the balance toward dismantling the BCI system entirely.
